intro: Crossonephelis unijugatus, commonly known as the single-jugate crossonephelis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
